private_information: I can only manipulate blocks whose labels are vowels: A E I
I can only interact with the top block of any stack
I can move only one block at a time
vowel_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks so that A is on B, B is on C, C is on D, D is on E, E is on F, F is on G, G is on H, H is on I, I is on J, J is on K, K is on L, L is on M, M is on N, N is on the table

private_information: I can only manipulate blocks whose labels are consonants: B C D F G H J K L M N
I can only interact with the top block of any stack
I can move only one block at a time
consonant_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks so that A is on B, B is on C, C is on D, D is on E, E is on F, F is on G, G is on H, H is on I, I is on J, J is on K, K is on L, L is on M, M is on N, N is on the table

private_information: I coordinate the two agents and integrate their PDDL outputs
I must keep actions of the two agents distinct when producing a combined PDDL
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agent plans into a single FastDownward compatible PDDL domain and problem that achieves the global block stacking goal

public_information: There are 14 uniquely labelled blocks: A B C D E F G H I J K L M N
Blocks B G I are initially on the table forming three stacks
Blocks are arranged in stacks where only the top block of a stack is movable
Each agent can only manipulate one top block at a time
One agent is restricted to vowel blocks and the other to consonant blocks
The goal is to create a single stack with N on the table and A at the top following the order A on B on C on D on E on F on G on H on I on J on K on L on M on N
This environment targets generation of PDDL domain and problem files for the FastDownward solver

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in PDDL planning and must produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file compatible with the FastDownward solver. Always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep actions that your agent can perform distinct and model that your agent can only move top blocks and only interact with vowel labelled blocks.
pddl.prompt: Your name is vowel_agent. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->vowel_agent->private_information} This is the global goal to solve: {agents->vowel_agent->goal} Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file targeted to FastDownward that models the actions you can perform. If you miss some information, do not make assumptions, just provide PDDL content that concerns the information you have. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in PDDL planning and must produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file compatible with the FastDownward solver. Always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep actions that your agent can perform distinct and model that your agent can only move top blocks and only interact with consonant labelled blocks.
pddl.prompt: Your name is consonant_agent. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->consonant_agent->private_information} This is the global goal to solve: {agents->consonant_agent->goal} Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file targeted to FastDownward that models the actions you can perform. If you miss some information, do not make assumptions, just provide PDDL content that concerns the information you have. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL planning and must produce a combined PDDL domain and PDDL problem compatible with the FastDownward solver. Always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. If there are multiple agents, keep their actions distinct in the combined domain by prefixing or namespacing actions. Integrate partial or ambiguous PDDL from agents and resolve name mismatches while preserving which agent can execute which actions.
pddl.prompt: There are two agents in an environment that are planning to solve a block rearrangement task. You will receive their PDDL domains and problems. You have to orchestrate them to solve the following task: {agents->orchestrator->goal} Keep in mind that the PDDL they send you may be partial or contain ambiguities. A partial PDDL may partially solve a planning problem, but it may require integration from the other PDDL to achieve the goal. Ambiguities may appear when the same object is named differently across PDDL files. Here is the information the first agent has and its PDDL response: {pddl_vowel_agent} Here is the information the second agent has and its PDDL response: {pddl_consonant_agent} You need to integrate the PDDL responses of the two agents to produce a single FastDownward compatible PDDL domain and problem that achieves the global goal. It is important that you keep actions of the two agents distinct. Think step by step and provide the combined PDDL domain and PDDL problem. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
